paragraphs: On Monday evening, June 23, in Prague, the "Kinobus" (Cinema Bus) - a free open-air cinema, will start operating. In this current, eighteenth season, it will delight the city residents until September 4, 2025.

In total, the "CinemaBus" will hold 44 free screenings in 11 districts of the city (including for the first time in the Kuntratice district). It will stay at each location for four days - from Monday to Thursday.
The project is organized by the Transport Company of Prague (DPP).
The mobile open-air cinema will offer visitors 220 seats and an unlimited number of seats on the grass.
For those who enjoy snacking while watching, a fast food tent will be organized.
🆓 Admission to all sessions is free, but for those willing to donate a few coins to charity, a special donation box will be prepared. The collected money will go to help children's homes.
🕘 The sessions will start in the evening as darkness falls - first at 9:45 PM, and then gradually the time will shift to 8:30 PM.
📍 You can check the addresses of locations and the schedule of sessions at this link.
🎬 The repertoire traditionally consists of new releases and films from recent years, including Hollywood blockbusters as well as Czech movies.

Among them are global hits like "Deadpool and Wolverine", "Wild Robot", "Anora", "Beetlejuice Beetlejuice", "Inglourious Basterds", "Despicable Me 4", "Bridget Jones's Crazy About the Boy", "Specials", Czech comedies "Vyšehrad Dvje", "Treasure", "Sea in the Yard", "On the Roof", and other films.
